name: nvclmod

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, cnvc), wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cnlm))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ NrmVec, c0 ∈ LMod, c0 ∈ NrmMod)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cnvc), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cnvc), wcel(c0, cnlm))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cnlm), wcel(c0, clmod))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ NrmVec → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ NrmVec → c0 ∈ NrmMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ NrmMod → c0 ∈ LMod)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cnvc), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cnvc), wcel(c0, cnlm))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cnlm), wcel(c0, clmod))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ NrmVec → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ NrmVec → c0 ∈ NrmMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ NrmMod → c0 ∈ LMod)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cnvc), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cnlm), wcel(c0, clmod))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ NrmVec → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ NrmMod → c0 ∈ LMod)

comment: A normed vector space is a left module. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2015.)
